title: Information Technology-Based Career Exploration Project: Socioeconomic Impact Analysis Linked to Smart Manufacturing and Biotechnology

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy and secondary-level science/mathematics knowledge, understanding of social systems (political, economic, cultural frameworks), and foundational economic concepts (market structures, resource allocation)
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented education linked to regional industry demands, utilizing smartphone apps/web tools. Strengthens civic competencies and future career design abilities by analyzing the impact of technological advancements on local communities (culture/institutions) and economies (employment/industrial structures).

learning_goals: Learners perform basic data encryption projects applying information security principles and cultivate digital citizenship to understand 4th Industrial Revolution-era civic rights/responsibilities.
Learners produce AR/VR-based smart manufacturing simulations, analyze occupational structure changes, and predict regional economic/employment impacts in the 4th Industrial Revolution era.

Learners use mobile spreadsheet tools (Google Sheets, Excel Mobile) to generate ≥3 data visualizations (bar, line, pie charts), apply ≥5 filtering conditions for analysis reports, and evaluate technological impacts on regional economies, employment, and social systems.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
